member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder
member.summary: Defines a property path builder that can creates a property path.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder._sb
member.summary: Indicates the inner builder.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a instance.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder.AppendProperty``1(System.String)
member.summary: Appends the specified property into the builder.
member.typeparam: The type of the argument references to.
member.param: The name of the property. Generally using expression is okay.
member.returns: The current instance. This return value and be used as chaining invocations.
member.remarks: For example, if the method invocation is AppendProperty<Path>(nameof(Path.Data)), the expanded property path will be (Path.Data). Please note that the argument is always a expression, due to C# language design, the expression will only keep the property name part Data as the string result instead of the full name Path.Data. This is why we should use an extra generic type parameter to expand the property path.
member.exception: Throws when generic type argument is a generic type.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder.AppendZeroIndex
member.summary: Appends the zero index [0] into the builder.
member.returns: The current instance. This return value and be used as chaining invocations.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Data.PropertyPathBuilder.AppendIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Appends the specified index into the builder.
member.returns: The current instance. This return value and be used as chaining invocations.
member.exception: Throws when the index is a negative value.

member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Interop.IInitializeWithWindow
member.summary: Exposes a method through which a client can provide an owner window to a Windows Runtime (WinRT) object used in a desktop application.

remarks.para:
When to initialize:
Implement this interface if your object needs to be provided with an owner window, generally to display UI. Most third-party applications will not need to implement this interface.

When to use:
Use this interface if you will provide an owner window to a WinRT object in a desktop application. For more information about this scenario, see
Classes that use IInitializeWithWindow .

This interface is implemented by the following objects. Note that this is necessarily an incomplete list; refer to an individual object's documentation to determine whether that object implements this interface.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Interop.IInitializeWithWindow.Initialize(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specifies an owner window to be used by a Windows Runtime (WinRT) object that is used in a desktop app.
member.param: The handle of the window to be used as the owner window.
member.remarks:
The method doesn't return anything, but the method returns an HResult value in the Win32 API. For more information, please visit
this link .
